roleset.name: draw attention away from something, not focused on what is at hand
roleset.note: DISTRACT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'distract' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from distract.01-v predicate notes)
DISTRACTION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, distract.01. Corresponds to VNcls amuse-31.1. (from distraction.01-n)
DISTRACTED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. (from distracted.01-j)
DISTRACTING-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from distracting.01-j)

example.name: all arguments
example.text: `` It 's distracting attention from serious issues , like how [*] to make DEA , FBI and Customs work together '' on drug enforcement [*T*-1].
example.arg: from serious issues , like how [*] to make DEA , FBI and Customs work together '' on drug enforcement [*T*-1]

example.name: passive
example.text: Troubled chains could see their sales drop as much as 8 % , he believes [0] [*T*-1], as managers-1 distracted [*]-1 by fears about the future allow their stores to get sloppy .

example.name: adjective example
example.src: BOLT P01, parts 2,3That would be extremely distracting when you 're on the look out for car bombs and AK - 47s .
example.text: That would be extremely distracting when you 're on the look out for car bombs and AK - 47s .
example.arg: when you're on the look out for car bombs and AK-47s.

example.name: Args 0 and 1
example.text: Beat starts chaos as he begins his distraction of the enemy crew.

example.name: oblique arg0
example.text: Matt Mitrione didn't want the 'distraction' of VADA testing before fight

example.name: args1 and 2
example.text: This hope is something that comes from every hockey fan wanting their fix, their distraction from real life doldrums.
